description: The ACL BlackInAI social is an event for those who self-identify as Black and are looking for a space to socialize, share ideas and to discuss research on NLP or AI. This social will involve an ice breaker and introductions, small presentations and details about the group Black in AI.
name: Black in AI Social

sessions.session_name: S-Session A (Fireside chat with Dr. Donia Scott)

description: The ACL QueerInAI social is an event for queer folks who work in NLP or AI to share their experiences, network with others, and discuss queer issues in research. To facilitate this, the social will involve a mix of mini-testimonials and breakout discussions. All event information will remain confidential to respect the privacy and safety of participants. People of all identities (including allies) are invited to attend!
name: Queer in AI Socials

description: Group Mentoring Sessions are round-table discussion/Q&A sessions for students and early-career researchers, respectively, especially those new to ACL, providing them a chance to interact with senior researchers in the field. Zoom links will be emailed separately for each group.
name: Group Mentoring

description: This is a panel discussion for undergraduate students, providing an opportunity for an informal chat with a group of NLP/computational linguistics researchers about research, graduate student life, and beyond. Zoom link will be emailed separately to participants.
name: Panel for Undergraduate Students

description: Birds of a feather meetups help junior researchers or researchers attending ACL for the first time strike up conversations with other researchers in their areas of interest. This can also be a good avenue for junior researchers to get feedback on ongoing ideas and learn about relevant ongoing projects at other groups/universities and facilitate more exchange of research ideas, and collaborative discussions.
name: Birds of a feather - Cognitive Modeling and Psycholinguistics
